Title: External controlled vocabularies support in Dataverse 5.7
Description: CESSDA Tools Hour: Dataverse presentation

Speakers: Jane Fry, Chantal Ripp, Meghan Goodchild
Title: Dataverse in Canada Series: Introduction and features you didn't know you needed!
Description: Scholars Portal Dataverse is a publicly accessible, secure, multi-disciplinary, multi-lingual repository for research data, searchable from anywhere in the world, with servers hosted in Canada. This repository platform includes features such as: permanent links (DOIs) that encourage citation of your data set; and allowing you to set licensing terms for access and reuse of your research data.

Speakers: Raman Prasad, Ellen Kraffmiller, Ethan Cowan
Title: Using OpenDP Library in Applications: DP Creator with Dataverse Integration
Description: Demo of bringing restricted files into DP Creator to create differentially private statistics that are deposited back into Dataverse as auxillary files.

Title: RSpace, DMPTool, and Dataverse Integration
Description: After importing DMPs into RSpace and exporting to Dataverse, a link to the Dataverse dataset is added to the DMP and its landing page.

Title: Closing Session (Dataverse Community Meeting 2021)
Description: Thanks for coming to #dataverse2021!

Title: Curation Workflows
Description: In order for data to be more easily discoverable, better understood, and re-usable, it must be âcuratedâ. There are many levels of data curation. The panelists for this session will describe the tools, best practices, and the level of curation performed on datasets in their respective Dataverse repositories.

Title: Preservation
Description: The main question of the session is what are the relevant preservation practices designed to ensure data in a Dataverse installation is usable for as long as it needs to be kept within the organizations. The experiences to be presented will explore what best practices exist to manage data preservation and the efforts that have been adopted so far by the Dataverse community for the purpose of archiving content to ensure interoperability, consistency and the safety and security of digital data.

Title: Software Metadata and Containerization
Description: Support for computational artifacts such as software, workflows, and containers is needed in the Dataverse software in order to meet the demands of advanced data analysis and enable research reproducibility and reuse. This session will feature invited presentations on software metadata Codemeta, Research Object and RO-Crate metadata, git integration, and adequate documentation and guidelines. We aim to identify practical considerations and implementation steps on the topic for the Dataverse software platform. Following the presentations and Q&A, we will have a discussion on shaping Dataverse software support for Codemeta, RO-Crate, and git integration.

Title: Integrations and External Tools
Description: We'll start with a brief intro discussing the history and philosophy behind the framework, then view some demos on these new and innovative projects: a tool to upload from Globus, a tool that can tie into a Request Access Workflow, a project that highlights datasets and papers that are conceptually similar to one another, and a tool for code readability and reproducibility.

Title: Geospatial Data
Description: Our community is pursuing a broad range of geospatial development, and design discussions, with this session aimed at furthering these discussions collectively to develop priorities for next steps.

Title: Sensitive Data
Description: An introduction to the DPCreator; overviews of the management of sensitive qualitative data and health policy research data; and an update on the Harvard Medical Schoolâs DMP tool and how it can help the community prepare to share sensitive data.

Title: Terms of Use, Licensing, Installation Policies
Description: High quality access to data outputs and published research objects depends on repositories clearly defining terms and licenses for reuse. This session will present an overview of the importance of data licensing, describe some of the recent work in the Dataverse Community for adding software support for multiple license options, and introduce opportunities and implications for machine readability and automation of licensing in the Dataverse software and other repositories.

Title: Remote Storage and Large Datasets
Description: This session will cover the need for affordable large data support. Currently, the high-cost constraints of bandwidth use stemming from cloud storage prevent many repositories from supporting and sharing large data.

Speakers: Philipp Conzett, John Graybeal, Jim Myers, Slava Tykhonov
Title: Flexible Metadata/Controlled Vocabularies
Description: We will present and discuss ongoing efforts and future ideas for improving the FAIR support of the Dataverse software focusing on metadata schemas and controlled vocabularies. Important issues will be raised such as interoperability, compliance with metadata standards, integration with external services, and the maintenance and sustainability of flexible metadata support.

Speakers: Sonia Barbosa, Karine Burger, Philipp Conzett, Laura Rezende
Title: CoreTrustSeal
Description: The CoreTrustSeal is the most widely used certification for helping establish trustworthy data repositories.

Title: GDCC/Governance Session 2 (Dataverse Community Meeting 2021)
Description: Financial updates, ongoing projects, GDCC website, Governance and Advisory Board

Title: GDCC/Governance Session 1 (Dataverse Community Meeting 2021)
Description: Financial updates, ongoing projects, GDCC website, Governance and Advisory Board

Speakers: Gary King, MercÃ¨ Crosas, Carole Anne Goble, Daniel S. Katz, Herbert Van de Sompel, Danny Brooke, Sonia Barbosa
Title: Plenary Sessions (Dataverse Community Meeting 2021)
Description: FAIR workflows and Research Objects get a workout, "Progress Toward More Sustainable Research Software", "FAIR Signposting: A KISS Approach to a Burning Issue", Dataverse Software - New Features and Future Plans, Community Update Videos

Title: Introduction to the Dataverse Software (Dataverse Community Meeting 2021)
Description: This session will introduce the Dataverse Software for data sharing and preservation, using the Harvard Dataverse Repository as the model. You will have an opportunity to learn about the software and how it can support institutional repositories, research projects, team projects, teaching courses, and the general data sharing needs of your community.

Speakers: Slava Tykhonov, Don Sizemore, Samuel Bernardo, Stefan Kasberger
Title: Automated CI/CD Testing, Installation and Deployment of a Dataverse Installation on a Cloud
Description: You will learn more about the Cloud related features available in the pyDataverse module, which is widely used by the Dataverse Community for various tasks. We are going to show some practical use cases with the Selenium framework used for automation testing for Jenkins integration. You will also learn about the Software Quality as a Service (SQAaaS) framework that was developed in EOSC Synergy project in the context of the European Open Science Cloud

Title: Graduate Studentsâ Attitudes Toward Data Sharing and Reproducibility
Description: Graduate Studentsâ Attitudes Toward Data Sharing and Reproducibility

Title: Repository Approaches to Improving the Quality of Shared Data and Code
Description: Approaches based on reproducibility, data curation, and gamified elements can be used to indicate and improve the quality of datasets in a repository.

Title: Supporting Computational Reproducibility: Updates on CoRe2 Development and AJPS Verification Policy Implementation
Description: Talk about the updates on the developments of the CoRe2 platform, the Dataverse collaboration, and the AJPS result verification policy implementation.

Title: 2020 Dataverse Community Meeting closing event
Description: Thanks for coming to #dataverse2020!

Speakers: Anna Dabrowski, Meghan Goodchild, Gustavo Durand
Title: Remote Storage/Large Datasets
Description: The Remote Storage/Large Datasets breakout session will include brief presentations from community members and group discussion about improving data transfer mechanisms and storage options for Dataverse repositories. Presentations will cover data upload developments, including Globus integration and direct upload to S3, as well as Trusted Remote Storage Agents (TRSA) for sensitive data, and managing multiple data stores. This session is an opportunity to hear about and provide feedback on the efforts of community members, discuss policy and service implications for managing repositories, and talk about further coordinating our efforts.

Speakers: Phil Durbin, Kaitlin Newson, Jim Myers, Kacper Kowalik, James Honaker, Kamil Guryn, Xinyue Ye, Mahsa Naseri, Matthew Dunlap, Tomasz Miksa
Title: External Tools
Description: External Tools intro, The Dataverse Data Curation Tool, A Previewer How To, Whole Tale as a Dataverse's External Tool, TwoRavens for Machine Learning, A set of a new Dataverse external tools for advanced data visualization in hard sciences, An Intelligent Dataset Discovery System for Dataverse, JMP integration, Data Curation and Verification Workflows Utilizing Containerization, Dataverse and Machine-actionable Data Management Plans

Speakers: Jonas Kahle, Philipp Conzett, Richard Fulss
Title: Flexible Metadata Session 2
Description: Panel of speakers will give brief talks on longer term metadata issues and projects that have major design implications. Discussion in this session will focus on opportunities, challenges, and priorities for long term features and design development to facilitate metadata integration and exchange.

Speakers: Olga Kurek, Steve McEachern, Martine Gagnon
Title: Flexible Metadata Session 1
Description: Panelists will give brief talks on metadata projects that have been recently implemented or are near-term opportunities. This discussion will focus on near-term metadata projects and possibilities that can be executed in the latest version.

Title: New Feature Demo
Description: Come and learn about the Dataverse releases and features from over the last year!

Title: Prototype 2 for Auto-completion based on existing database values for the field Keyword. #6154
Description: A demo for the second of two proposals for enhancing Dataverse's ability to handle controlled vocabularies. See #6154.

Title: Prototype 1 for Auto-completion based on existing database values for the field Keyword. #6154
Description: A demo for the first of two proposals for enhancing Dataverse's ability to handle controlled vocabularies. See #6154.

Title: The Dataverse Data Curation Tool
Description: Learn how data owners and curators can create and edit metadata at the variable level, view summary statistics and charts about their data, and more!

Title: Dataverse: A Software, a Community, a Network of Repositories
Description: Presentation at the NIH worksop on Establishing a FAIR Biomedical Data Ecosystem: The Role of Generalist  and Institutional Repositories to Enhance Data Discoverability and Reuse. Starts at 2:24:38.

Title: Advancing science with Dataverse
Description: A talk at FOSDEM where Dataverse and FAIR data principles are introduced to open source developers.

Title: What is Harvard Dataverse?
Description: A brief introduction to sharing, finding, and exploring data using Harvard Dataverse.

Description: Short demonstration (video-only) of how Whole Tale can be used as an external tool to explore and compute on existing replication datasets. See the integration notes for additional details.

Title: Registering Data from Dataverse in Whole Tale v0 8
Description: Short demonstration (video-only) of how to analyze source data from Dataverse in Whole Tale. See the integration notes

Speakers: Eugene Barsky, Mark Goodwin, Paul Dante
Title: Geodisy
Description: Eugene Barsky, Research Data Services Librarian at the University of British Columbia Library, will address their current work on GeoBlacklight integration with Dataverse.

Description: Official invitation from Slava Tykhonov (DANS-KNAW) to join European Dataverse Workshop which will be held in TromsÃ¸, Norway, January 23-24, 2020.

Description: Keynote at the Swiss Open Science Action Plan Kick-off at EPFL.

Title: Developing, Packing, and Sharing Reproducible Research Objects: The Whole Tale Approach
Description: In this DataONE webinar, existing and planned integrations between Whole Tale and Dataverse were described.

Title: Building reproducible workflows for earth sciences - Responding to reproducibility challenges from physics to social sciences
Description: Keynote at the workshop "Building reproducible workflows for earth sciences" at ECMWF

Description: Phil introduces Dataverse reproducibility initiatives to The Turing Way community.

Description: Clips from the conference set to music

Title: Topics in Research Data Management #6
Description: Sonia M. Barbosa, Manager of Data Curation and Acquisition for the Harvard Dataverse Project and Manager of the Murray Research Archive, will discuss outreach to researchers to get more buy in and gatekeeping submissions to avoid messy metadata and private or sensitive data

Title: Dataverse in the European Open Science Cloud
Description: Updates on DataverseEU, Weblate, developement process, and more.

Title: Topics in Research Data Management #5
Description: Jonathan Crabtree, Assistant Director for Cyberinfrastructure at The Odum Institute of UNC Chapel Hill, discusses remote storage for Dataverse

Description: Zenodo, Dataverse, and Dryad join MDC to talk about their process implementing standardized data usage metrics

Title: Topics in Research Data Management #4
Description: Amy Nurnberger, Program Head, Data Management Services at MIT Libraries, discusses how to leverage campus connections for RDM

Description: Eric Kaltman, CLIR Fellow for Data Curation in the Sciences at Carnegie Mellon University Libraries, shares liaison workflows.

Description: Sherry Lake, Scholarly Repository Librarian at University of Virginia Libraries, discusses Open Science Framework (OSF) integration with Dataverse.

Description: Joel describes Archivematica's integration with Dataverse and demonstrates how to preserve Dataverse materials for long-term storage.

Title: Publishing datasets in Dataverse
Description: This video is a quick guide on how to publish datasets in Dataverse.

Title: Publishing a dataverse
Description: This video is a quick guide on how to create, edit or publish a dataverse.

Title: Finding and exploring data
Description: This video provides a brief overview on how to use Dataverse to find and explore data.

Title: Topics in Research Data Management #1
Description: Amber Leahey, University of Toronto Libraries, discusses recent grant funding and new features in Dataverse in the coming year.

Title: Reproducibility and Dataverse
Description: Current and future efforts to improve scientific reproducibility in the Dataverse ecosystem.

Title: Texas Data Repository - A Year in Review
Description: The Texas Data Repository (TDR) is a consortial data repository using the Dataverse platform. In this presentation we discuss ongoing efforts to develop the TDR as a shared service. The presenters include TDR liaisons from participating institutions. We reflect on the past year of using the TDR and speak from diverse perspectives: the experience of small and large institutions; institutions with varying capacity to provide data services; and institutions implementing different outreach strategies, policies and workflows. We discuss the progress of the TDR, the value of participating in a consortial repository service, successes and challenges, and future goals.

Title: Tilburg University awarded CoreTrustSeal
Description: Tilburg University is the first Dutch university awarded the Data Seal of Approval, now known as the CoreTrustSeal.

Title: Dataverse and Spark
Description: Implementation of the Open Service Broker specification for connecting Dataverse to OpenShift on the Mass Open Cloud (MOC). Also demonstrated a sample application running an Apache Spark cluster.

Title: Scaling Dataverse
Description: Our project is to advance this initial containerization work toward making Dataverse more scalable.

Title: Texas State University Dataverse Launch
Description: We are pleased to announce the official launch of the Texas State University Dataverse, a repository for research datasets created by Texas State researchers.

Title: Introducing Dataverse to LibrePlanet
Description: An introduction to Dataverse for the free and open source software community.

Title: Research Data Management Basics
Description: This is an introduction to the concept of Research Data Management and to the Data Management Plan with a very short introduction to the Texas State University Dataverse.

Title: Managing permissions and restrictions
Description: In this video learn how to manage permissions and restrictions in your dataverse.

Title: Publishing datasets
Description: In this video learn how to publish datasets to your dataverse.

Title: Dataverse customization
Description: In this video learn how to customize your Dataverse.

Title: Dataverse overview
Description: This video provides a broad overview of Dataverse and some of the new capabilities found in Dataverse 4.

Title: RSpace ELN and Dataverse Integration
Description: How to send selected work from RSpace to your preferred Dataverse archive.

Title: Best Practices for Research Data Management
Description: In Canada, as in many developed countries, requirements for data management are being established across a wide range of scholarly disciplines. In this presentation, Eugene Barsky from the University of British Columbia's ARC Team will offer UBC Library expertise in managing thousands of data files with Dataverse software.

Title: Data Visualisations for TwoRavens
Description: A tool to augment TwoRavens, a data analysis tool for Dataverse, to give it visualization capability.

Title: TROLLing - why linguists need it
Description: TROLLing is a research database for linguists. See how it can be useful for you in your research.

Title: Bean Validation: Practical Examples from a Real-World Java EE 7 Application
Description: How Dataverse uses bean validation.

Description: This video demonstrates a new plugin linking OJS to Dataverse.
